description.narrative: The goal of this project is to target 1000 vulnerable families who have suffered losses due to hurricane Maria. The project will be focused in Adjuntas, and Utuardo municipalities in central Puerto Rico where the majority of families have not had access to electricity or running water since hurricane Maria. By providing families with solar lanterns and water filters, we can address two pressing needs as families work to rebuild their lives. We will be collaborating with Casa Pueblo de Adjuntas on the distribution, a local NGO with strong roots in the community and 40 years of experience with community organizing. The distribution will begin December 15th, 2017 and will be completed by January 30th, 2017. The project seeks two outcomes: 1. 1,000 Families have access to water filters for personal consumption and hygiene needs 2. 1,000 Families who have lost power due to hurricane Maria have access to solar-powered lanterns
